## Learning Objectives

By the end of this lecture, you will be able to:

-   Understand the <span style="color: tomato;">fundamental concepts</span> of <span style="color: tomato;">model fitting</span> and <span style="color: tomato;">calibration</span>
-   Apply <span style="color: tomato;">least squares estimation</span> to <span style="color: tomato;">compartmental models</span>
-   Implement <span style="color: tomato;">maximum likelihood estimation</span> for <span style="color: tomato;">epidemic models</span>
-   Compare the <span style="color: tomato;">strengths and weaknesses</span> of different <span style="color: tomato;">fitting methods</span>
-   Recognize when to use <span style="color: tomato;">advanced methods</span> like <span style="color: tomato;">MCMC</span> and <span style="color: tomato;">particle filtering</span>
-   <span style="color: tomato;">Troubleshoot</span> common <span style="color: tomato;">fitting problems</span>
